name: priggishly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is typical of a prig (= a person who obeys the rules of correct behaviour and considers himself or herself to be morally better than other people): "I'm actually working on something rather important," he said priggishly. She was priggishly disapproving of the values of those around her.
More examplesFewer examplesWhen Gerald learns the truth, he priggishly demands that George does the right thing and marries his mother.His priggishly self-satisfied behaviour was repellent.
